channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Stowaway found dead in landing gear of American Airlines flight in Charlotte
item.description: Police say maintenance workers discovered the body Sunday morning after the plane landed from Europe.
item.content:encoded:
Police say maintenance workers discovered the body Sunday morning after the plane landed from Europe.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Suspect held after allegedly firing from boat into waterfront bar in North Carolina
item.description: The attack took place at the American Fish Company, a bar and live music venue. Police are asking anyone who witnessed the shooting to contact them.
item.content:encoded:
The attack took place at the American Fish Company, a bar and live music venue. Police are asking anyone who witnessed the shooting to contact them.

(Image credit: Chris Seward)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Ryder Cup MC steps down over foul-mouthed chant aimed at golfer Rory McIlroy
item.description: Some of the golf at this year's Ryder Cup has been overshadowed by interventions from passionate and unruly fans, as Americans tee off against Europeans in one of the sport's biggest events.
item.content:encoded:
Some of the golf at this year's Ryder Cup has been overshadowed by interventions from passionate and unruly fans, as Americans tee off against Europeans in one of the sport's biggest events.

(Image credit: Carl Recine)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 4 dead, 8 injured
item.description: Multiple people were shot at a Mormon church in Michigan that was then set on fire, authorities said Sunday. The shooter was killed by police.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple people were shot at a Mormon church in Michigan that was then set on fire, authorities said Sunday. The shooter was killed by police.

(Image credit: Carlos Osorio)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump
item.description: The death toll in the Israel-Hamas war has topped 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry said, a day before the Israeli Prime Minister heads for talks with U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The death toll in the Israel-Hamas war has topped 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry said, a day before the Israeli Prime Minister heads for talks with U.S. President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Maine's food pantries stare down volunteer shortage while anticipating cuts
item.description: Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England. In March, the Trump administration cut more than $1 billion from two U.S. food programs.
item.content:encoded:
Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England. In March, the Trump administration cut more than $1 billion from two U.S. food programs.

(Image credit: Katherine Emery/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
item.description: In Mexico, September means chiles en nogada season. But one key ingredient, a candied barrel cactus called biznaga, is now illegal because it's vanishing in the wild.
item.content:encoded:
In Mexico, September means chiles en nogada season. But one key ingredient, a candied barrel cactus called biznaga, is now illegal because it's vanishing in the wild.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead
item.description: President Trump failed to revoke DACA in his first term and his focus on immigration this time has mostly ignored the policy. Still, Republican lawmakers are deferring to the president on the issue.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump failed to revoke DACA in his first term and his focus on immigration this time has mostly ignored the policy. Still, Republican lawmakers are deferring to the president on the issue.

(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Why friends are teaming up to buy homes
item.description: Buying a home is a conventional milestone for couples. But as home prices skyrocket, many Americans are buying homes with someone who isn't their romantic partner.
item.content:encoded:
Buying a home is a conventional milestone for couples. But as home prices skyrocket, many Americans are buying homes with someone who isn't their romantic partner.

(Image credit: Via Hayley Currier and Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Rhaina Cohen

item.title: Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Zelenskyy urges world not to "turn a blind eye"
item.description: Zelenskyy called the attacks "pure terrorism" and urged Europe and the U.S. to respond with tougher sanctions and stronger defenses.
item.content:encoded:
Zelenskyy called the attacks "pure terrorism" and urged Europe and the U.S. to respond with tougher sanctions and stronger defenses.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman
